user.biography:
Share your passion with hashtag #onthewine 
🌍 𝙱𝚊𝚜𝚎𝚍 𝚒𝚗 𝙿𝚊𝚛𝚒𝚜 🇫🇷
🆕 Discover our children’s book “The wonderful world of wine” available in 🇮🇹/🇬🇧👇🏻👇🏻👇🏻

node.text: Wonderful suite at Castello di Semivicoli with @masciarelli_winery

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Enrico&Diletta in Franciacorta with @villacrespiafranciacorta, and @dilettaqc. May be an image of bottle.

node.text: For all Franciacorta’s lovers: 11/12 and 18/19 September is the Franciacorta Festival! A great occasion to discover all the secrets and news about this world, in the heart of Lombardy 🇮🇹 we already started our journey with a well-knows glass of @villacrespiafranciacorta Millè! If you wish to try the famous light-blue label, don’t lose this occasion 🙌🏻 Cheers! 🥂

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Enrico&Diletta in Children Books with @oneverystreet, @ornellaqc, @dilettaqc, and @federighieditori. May be an image of book and outdoors.

node.text:
🇮🇹/🇬🇧 
Notizia bomba!! Siamo felicissimi di annunciarvi che è finalmente disponibile “Il fantastico mondo del vino”, il libro per bambini scritto da me e Diletta con @federighieditori 📖🍷 un libro da disegnare e colorare in cui Polly, l’ape curiosa, guiderà i piccoli lettori alla scoperta del vino, la sua produzione e le curiosità storiche. Il libro è stato scritto in lingua italiana e inglese e trovate il link per l’acquisto sul nostro profilo. Siamo curiosissimi di sapere cosa ne pensate 🤩🤩🤩

Attenzione: il libro ha lo scopo di far conoscere in modo divertente le caratteristiche, la storia e produzione del vino. Non promuove in alcun modo l’uso di alcolici.
——
Big news!! We are very proud to announce you that is finally available to shop “The wonderful world of wine”, a children’s book wrote by me and Diletta with @federighieditori 📖🍷 a drawing and coloring book in which Polly, the curious bee, would lead young readers to discover the wine’s world, production and historical curiosities. The book is available in both Italian and English and you can find the link to shop on our profile. We are very curious to know your feedback 🤩🤩🤩

Attention: the purpose or this book is to cultivate a knowledge of wine and it’s history, production and characteristics, in a fun and simple way. It does not promote the use of alcohol in any way.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Enrico&Diletta in Sicilia, Italy with @wineofsiciliadoc, and @dilettaqc. May be an image of 1 person and outdoors.

node.text:
🇮🇹/🇬🇧 
Noi siamo pronti per un altro aperitivo a tema Sicilia con @wineofsiciliadoc, questa volta vi portiamo a scoprire il “Grillo”, un vitigno a bacca bianca coltivato soprattutto nella parte occidentale dell’isola.
Grazie alla sua diffusione e caratteristiche, il Grillo costituisce la base di moltissimi vini bianchi Siciliani. Al naso possiamo cogliere le note fruttate dei tipici agrumi del territorio, mentre una volta in bocca spicca subito la sapidità tipica dei bianchi del territorio. Siete pronti? Riempite il calice e gustiamoci un po’ di Sicilia 🌞
—
We are ready for another Sicilian aperitif with @wineofsiciliadoc, today we bring you to discover “Grillo”, a white-berry grape variety grown mainly in the island’s west coast. Thanks to its spreading and characteristics, Grillo forms the basis of many Sicilian white wines. The nose citrus fruity notes, typical of the island, the mouthfeel has a noteworthy balance between its freshness and salinity. Are you ready? Fill your glass and taste a sip of Sicily 🌞

#winesofsicily
#DocSicilia #ConsorzioDocSicilia #ViniDocSicilia #SiciliaDoc
#adv

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Enrico&Diletta in Champagne Gremillet with @champagnegremillet, and @dilettaqc. May be an image of 1 person and outdoors.

node.text:
None: “How was your last visit to @champagnegremillet?”
Me: “Watch me. 😂”
I have to say it guys, we had lot of fun with Gremillet’s Family! They’re a 40y old winery, quite new that’s true, but with strong passion and love for the champagne’s world.  When you met them, it’s clear there’s heart in what they are doing, from the lovable Anne that would follow you during the visit, until they’re wonderful and crazy oenologist that will make you fall in love with their champagne! Be sure, you’ll be hearing from them again soon!
Like they love to say: “All your successes deserve a Gremillet” 🥂 cheers guys!

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Enrico&Diletta in Italy with @kiemberger, @dilettaqc, and @franz_haas_winery. May be an image of 1 person.

node.text:
🇮🇹/🇬🇧
È il momento dell’aperitivo e ancora una volta noi ci facciamo trovare pronti! Visto che in estate siamo tutti alla ricerca del vino bianco perfetto che possa accompagnare la fine delle nostre giornate, lasciate che vi racconti qualcosa in più su @altoadigewines e i suoi splendidi prodotti. Se non lo sapevate, nessun altra regione in Italia vanta un numero così elevato di vini bianchi prestigiosi. Dal Gewürztraminer al Sauvignon, passando per il Müller-Thurgau: questi sono solo alcuni dei bianchi del territorio di altissima qualità che potete trovare. Tuttavia, se vi sentite smarriti e non sapete da dove iniziare, seguite i nostri consigli e siamo sicuri non ve ne pentirete. Noi oggi vogliamo provare qualche Sauvignon blanc, ci manca un po’ la Francia e questo è un antico vitigno di origine francese che ci piace ritrovare quando possiamo. Il Sauvignon è sicuramente uno dei bianchi di punta dell’Alto Adige ed è perfetto per l’aperitivo! Noi, non sapendo quale scegliere, anche questa volta ne abbiamo voluti provare due: @franz_haas_winery, sapido e mirale con ottima persistenza, e @kiemberger più maturo e morbido, con un parte di maturazione in barriques. Se li avete già provati, fateci sapere quali dei due preferite! 
Cheers 🥂
—
It’s aperitif time! Being summer here, we are all looking for the perfect white wine to end our days: that’s why we want to tell you something more about @altoadigewines
If you didn’t know, this the first Italian region in terms of numbers of prestigious white wines. From the Gewürztraminer to Sauvignon: those are just some of the high quality whites you can find here. 
Anyway, if you fell lost and you don’t know form where you could start, follow our tips and we are sure you would not regret it! Today we want to try some Sauvignon blanc, we are missing France a bit and this is an ancient french vine that we love to drink when we have the occasion. Sauvignon it’s for sure one of the most famous and well know Alto Adige’s wines, a perfect pair for your aperitif. We didn’t know which one to choose, so we decided to try both: @franz_haas_winery, savoury and mineral, and @kiemberger more mature and partially aged in barriques. *ad

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Enrico&Diletta on July 29, 2021 tagging @dilettaqc, and @maisonlouveciennes. May be an image of 1 person and outdoors.

node.text:
Looking for a beach while in Paris? Come at @maisonlouveciennes 🏝
Few minutes far from Paris, it’s the perfect place if you’re missing the sea! Buffet all you can eat (we loved tuna with fruits and vitello tonnato!), dessert included! If not enough, you also have an extra dish from the menu: we took prawns and fish roasted, perfectly matched with our glasses of wines. What makes everything perfect? The table directly on the beach, and your desire of sea is satisfied! Last but not least, they have a wonderful “pétanque” field in which you can play boules at the end of the dinner! And voilà, la mer a Paris! Cheers 🥂

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Enrico&Diletta on July 29, 2021 tagging @dilettaqc, and @maisonlouveciennes. May be an image of 1 person and outdoors.
Photo shared by Enrico&Diletta on July 29, 2021 tagging @dilettaqc, and @maisonlouveciennes. May be an image of outdoors.
Photo shared by Enrico&Diletta on July 23, 2021 tagging @chefwestermann, @dilettaqc, @lecoq_fils, and @cyril.menard.35. May be an image of food and indoor.

node.text:
If you are a fan of French poultry, we have probably spotted the best place for you here in Paris, few minutes far from Montmartre: @lecoqrico_paris created by the famous Strasbourg chef Antoine Westermann who opened his first restaurant, Le Buerehiesel, at 23y (and got ⭐️⭐️⭐️ Michelin Stars few years later!). Speciality of the house: an entire roast chicken slow cooked, a speciality of the chef! On top of that, we have to say that chef Antoine is a truly lover of poultry breeds! Here you can only found traditional poultry breeds that were raised before industrial farming. Having being selected over time, they have better disease resistance and thrive in open pastures. You would be able to recognise the quality since the first tasting!
Definitely a place to go when in Paris 🙌🏻
Have a nice weekend guys! 🥂

location.name: Le Coq Rico - Le Bistrot des Belles Volailles

node.text:
🇮🇹 / 🇬🇧
E adesso quale stappo? Oggi torniamo in Sicilia con @wineofsiciliadoc, terra straordinaria che conta più di 70 varietà di uve! Qui sono in compagnia di 3 punte di diamante dell’isola: Lucido, Grillo e Nero d’Avola, tutti con denominazione “Sicilia DOC”, simbolo di qualità e rispetto delle antiche tradizioni di vinificazione del territorio. La scelta si prospetta davvero ardua..voi cosa preferite in estate? Meglio stappare uno dei loro bianchi profumati, o lasciarsi sedurre dal rosso rubino del Nero d’Avola? Cheers 🍷🌞
———————
And now which one should I pop? Today we come back to Sicily with @wineofsiciliadoc, an extraordinary land that counts more than 70 grape varieties! Here I am with the top 3 island’s crown jewels: Lucido, Grillo e Nero d’Avola, all “Sicilia DOC”, symbol of quality and respect of the country’s ancient wine-making traditions. The choice is not easy at all...which one do you prefer? Better one of their fragrant white wines, or being seduced by the Nero d’Avola’s ruby red color? Cheers 🍷🌞

#wineofsicily #DocSicilia #ConsorzioDocSicilia #ViniDocSicilia #SiciliaDoc *ad

node.text:
New nephew arrived 🤩 Uncles once again, and for the first time it’s a wonderful girl! There’s no better reason to pop our @bellavistawine Rosè 2016 🍾 
Let’s go pink 💕 Happy friday guysss

node.accessibility_caption: Tennis, Roland Garros, lunch time, champagne

node.text:
Lunch time at Roland Garros with @poteletchabot 🎾🎾🎾

As I already said, Roland Garros is definitely something you have to put on your todo list, not only because of the beauty of the sport, but also because of the vibes and the feeling you have once there! 
It was such a great pleasure to meet there Stéphane and Maeva during the lunch, a great moment to enjoy some fresh glasses of Champagne and learn more about Potel & Chabot. Born in 1820, they are managing and creating exceptional events since more than 200+ years. Just to give you an idea, they’re supporting the Roland Garros tournament since 1980! The precise and meticulous attention from the service to the cuisine, are just some of their great strengths. Here you can see a great example of the themed aperitif  we had! Check our highlights stories to discover more about Potel & Chabot at @rolandgarros

And you? Have you ever been at Roland Garros? 🤩🤩

#poteletchabot
#poteletchabotxrg

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Enrico&Diletta in Sicily, Italy with @wineofsiciliadoc, and @dilettaqc. May be an image of 2 people and outdoors.

node.text:
🇮🇹 / 🇬🇧

Ciao ragazzi! 
Oggi partiamo alla scoperta della Sicilia e dei fantastici vini che la caratterizzano.🗺🧳☀️

È un’isola meravigliosa, con paesaggi da sogno, una cucina ricca di sapori e colori ed una straordinaria cultura del vino. 🍇

Insieme al consorzio di tutela del vino @wineofsiciliadoc, iniziamo il nostro viaggio nello splendido mondo del vino in Sicilia. 🍷

Cominciamo subito dicendovi che sul territorio possiamo identificare moltissime tipologie di vitigni. Il primo che abbiamo provato è il “Lucido”, un bianco fruttato e leggermente floreale caratterizzato da notevole freschezza ed una certa acidità.
Con il pesce si abbina davvero bene ma, noi ce lo stiamo godendo come aperitivo in questa luminosa giornata di sole primaverile! 🌱

Continuate a seguirci su @enrico.onthewine per non perdere le nostre avventure alla scoperta della Sicilia con @wineofsiciliadoc! 🥂
A prestissimo!!
————
Ciao guys!!
Today we are going to start a new adventure and discover the beautiful Sicily and her wonderful wines 🗺🧳☀️

A beautiful island with breathtaking landscapes, a cuisine rich in flavours and a charming wine culture. 🍇

Together with the consortium for the protection of the wine @wineofsiciliadoc, we star our journey towards the world of Sicilian’s wines🍷

On the territory we may identified many different types of vines. The first one we tasted is “Lucido”, a fruity and floreal white wine with a great freshness and marked acidity. It would definitely be a great pair with fish dishes, however we are enjoying it as aperitif in this sunny spring day! 🌱

Keep follow us on @enrico.onthewine and discover our next Sicilian’s adventures with @wineofsiciliadoc! 🥂
See you very soon guys!!

#winesofsicily
#DocSicilia
#ConsorzioDocSicilia
#ViniDocSicilia
#SiciliaDoc
#adv
